More details about this will be released around mid term. ## üöÄ Ground Rules :::{.callout-note icon="false"} # ü´° Ground Rules Please adhere to these core principles throughout the course: ::: ### Be Open-Minded {.unnumbered} - Approach new concepts and methods without preconceptions. - Set aside any stereotypes or misconceptions about digital technologies in humanities. - Remain receptive to diverse perspectives and unconventional ideas. ### Embrace Frustration as Progress {.unnumbered} - Understand that frustration is a normal part of the learning process. - View challenges as opportunities for growth rather than obstacles. - Give yourself time to work through difficult concepts or technical issues. ### Own Your Learning {.unnumbered} - Take responsibility for your learning in this course. - Actively seek out resources and ask questions when you need help. - Set personal learning goals and work consistently towards achieving them. ### Don't Fool Yourself {.unnumbered} - Be honest about your understanding and progress. - Acknowledge your limitations and areas for improvement. - Critically examine your assumptions and conclusions. :::{.callout-note} ## Remember By following these principles, you'll create a positive learning experience for yourself and contribute to a supportive classroom environment for everyone. :::
